meanings.definition: A type of fig tree native to India and Pakistan.
meanings.sent1: The pipal tree provides shade with its wide branches.
meanings.sent2: People in India often gather under the pipal tree for community meetings.
meanings.sent3: The birds chirped happily in the branches of the pipal tree.
meanings.sent4: The pipal tree stood tall like a guardian in the village square.
meanings.sent5: The rustling leaves of the pipal tree created a soothing sound.

meanings.definition: The heart-shaped leaves of the pipal tree.
meanings.sent1: Children collected fallen pipal leaves to make art projects.
meanings.sent2: The wind gently rustled the pipal leaves in the afternoon.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel made a cozy nest using pipal leaves and twigs.
meanings.sent4: Her love for nature was evident in the way she admired the pipal leaves.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant green color of the pipal leaves brightened up the garden.

meanings.definition: The sacred tree under which Siddhartha Gautama is said to have attained enlightenment, also known as the Bodhi tree.
meanings.sent1: Many pilgrims travel to pay respects to the pipal tree where Buddha meditated.
meanings.sent2: The serene atmosphere under the pipal tree encouraged deep contemplation.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous monkeys played around the pipal tree, adding joy to the solemn site.
meanings.sent4: The wisdom of the ages seemed to whisper through the leaves of the pipal tree.
meanings.sent5: The aura of peace surrounding the pipal tree was palpable to all who visited.
